content: turn work so that ws is facing and join in yarn keeping in pattern work the neckline as follows note that you will be beginning each row on the ws and ending on the rs work 16 19 20 21 sts w&t work to eor continue as established with w&t on the st before the previous w&t 3x 13 16 17 18 sts work 1 row with w&t on the last st last row k4 7 8 9 w&t p4 7 8 9 cut yarn place sts on holder finishing neck band join shoulders place the front and back left side shoulder sts back onto needles line up the needles with ws decrease and 3nbo pw repeat for right side shoulder sts binding off kw if you want a less visible shoulder seam 3nbo on the ws instead of the rs if you want an invisible seam join the shoulders using kitchener stitch pick up stitches for neck band starting at the right shoulder using the 24 smaller circular needle work in k1 p1 rib across the back to the left shoulder be sure to knit all the wraps from the w&t pu and knit keeping in k1 p1 rib 1 st from the shoulder seam and then 3 sts for each 4 row on the left straight edge of the front neckline work across the sts of the front neckline then pu the same number of sts on the right edge ending at the right shoulder seam place shoulder sts on dpns to join if you do not have an even number sts pu an extra st with 3nbo or kitchener stitch 5 place marker for start of round round 1 * kb1 p1 repeat* to eor round 2 * k1 p1 repeat* to eor repeat rounds 1-2 until neck band measures 1½ 4 cm or length desired bobble loosely sew side seams using mattress stitch the seam ridge on the ws gives stability to the sides of the neck band and shoulder detail vest sew in all ends block wet thoroughly squeeze gently and roll in a towel to remove excess water lay flat and pull into shape then leave to dry finished
